file_content.text: I'm officially impressed. If only I could ensure you'd be around for every crisis....
Your being here, it's given me hope. Let's stop this plague.
Excuse me. My full attention's required for outbreak crisis protocol seven.
Status update?
We've exhausted outbreak crisis protocols one through fifteen. No effect. Rest assured, Mister Hyland, that I have many more scenarios yet to attempt.
I'm sure we'll prevail, sir. One thing: I have lost some workers to the plague. Perhaps you could spare more personnel?
Don't know how much difference one fresh body will make, but it looks like you've got a pretty sturdy one with you there now. Hyland out.
In need of fresh bodies? Looks like you've got volunteers close enough to breathe on you there. Hyland out.
Oh, thank the heavens that's over! Do you know how hard it is to essentially lie to that man? That's Addalar Hyland! He makes weapons!
Thank you. Your confidence and calm seem to be a rarity down there.
I'm told the rakghoul population is at its worst down here. Rest assured, that won't be the case for long.
Relax. I'm here to help.
I can hardly believe someone so frantic's in charge of an emergency situation.
Some crisis specialist....
Hyland has the right to hear the truth, don't you think?
Why lie?
So you are a volunteer? First good news I've had since I was assigned down here.
You have every one of your top aid workers turn into bloodthirsty monsters and see what it does to your composure.
It's bad down here--about as bad as it can get. This is the epicenter of the plague--has to be.
If you can thin out the rakghoul population, we just might have a shot at averting a galactic pandemic. Best of luck to you.
I only really lied about my state of mind--but now that you're here, I feel better about our chances. I should warn you, though....
